Ecclesiasticus *__03.1: The sons of wisdom are the church of the just: and their generation, obedience and love.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.2: Children, hear the judgment of your father, and so do that you may be saved.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.3: For God hath made the father honourable to the children: and seeking the judgment of the mothers, hath confirmed it upon the children.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.4: He that loveth God, shall obtain pardon for his sins by prayer, and shall refrain himself from them, and shall be heard in the prayer of days.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.5: And he that honoureth his mother is as one that layeth up a treasure.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.6: He that honoureth his father shall have joy in his own children, and in the day of his prayer he shall be heard.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.7: He that honoureth his father shall enjoy a long life: and he that obeyeth the father, shall be a comfort to his mother.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.8: He that feareth the Lord, honoureth his parents, and will serve them as his masters that brought him into the world.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.9: Honour thy father, in work and word, and all patience,
Ecclesiasticus *__03.10: That a blessing may come upon thee from him, and his blessing may remain in the latter end.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.11: The father's blessing establisheth the houses of the children: but the mother's curse rooteth up the foundation.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.12: Glory not in the dishonour of thy father: for his shame is no glory to thee.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.13: For the glory of a man is from the honour of his father, and a father without honour is the disgrace of the son.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.14: Son, support the old age of thy father, and grieve him not in his life;
Ecclesiasticus *__03.15: And if his understanding fail, have patience with him, and despise him not when thou art in thy strength: for the relieving of the father shall not be forgotten.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.16: For good shall be repaid to thee for the sin of thy mother.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.17: And in justice thou shalt be built up, and in the day of affliction thou shalt be remembered: and thy sins shall melt away as the ice in the fair warm weather.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.18: Of what an evil fame is he that forsaketh his father: and he is cursed of God that angereth his mother.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.19: My son, do thy works in meekness, and thou shalt be beloved above the glory of men.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.20: The greater thou art, the more humble thyself in all things, and thou shalt find grace before God:
Ecclesiasticus *__03.21: For great is the power of God alone, and he is honoured by the humble.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.22: Seek not the things that are too high for thee, and search not into things above thy ability: but the things that God hath commanded thee, think on them always, and in many of his works be not curious.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.23: For it is not necessary for thee to see with thy eyes those things that are hid.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.24: In unnecessary matters be not over curious, and in many of his works thou shalt not be inquisitive.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.25: For many things are shewn to thee above the understanding of men.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.26: And the suspicion of them hath deceived many, and hath detained their minds in vanity.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.27: A hard heart shall fear evil at the last: and he that loveth danger shall perish in it.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.28: A heart that goeth two ways shall not have success, and the perverse of heart shall be scandalized therein.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.29: A wicked heart shall be laden with sorrows, and the sinner will add sin to sin.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.30: The congregation of the proud shall not be healed: for the plant of wickedness shall take root in them, and it shall not be perceived.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.31: The heart of the wise is understood in wisdom, and a good ear will hear wisdom with all desire.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.32: A wise heart, and which hath understanding, will abstain from sins, and in the works of justice shall have success.
Ecclesiasticus *__03.33: Water quencheth a flaming fire, and alms resisteth sins:
Ecclesiasticus *__03.34: And God provideth for him that sheweth favour: he remembereth him afterwards, and in the time of his fall he shall find a sure stay.
